channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 148, New Cavendish Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: Large amount of litter and broken glass in alley behind 82 Llanover Road building, 11th June
item.description:
There has been a large and persistent build-up of rubbish in the alleyway behind 82 Llanover Road, SE18. The rubbish includes broken glass bottles, food containers, plastic, and general waste. Some of the litter has been there for over six months. Every morning, many children walk through this alley on their way to and from school, including my child. It is unpleasant to look at, and the broken glass is dangerous for children. I try to clean the area just outside our back gate myself – sweeping up glass and rubbish – because we use this back entrance every morning to go to school. But unfortunately, the litter keeps reappearing, and I cannot manage it alone. Please could this area be cleaned as soon as possible? Regular cleaning would also help prevent future build-up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eglinton Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over growth impacting on fence bordering my home., 11th June
item.description:

item.title: Overflowing rubbish bins and fly tipping, 11th June
item.description:
The bins outside these flats have not been emptied for weeks and now people have started to fly tip around them. There is tape around them indicating they have the wrong waste in them but since they are open for anyone to use, it is wrong to make the residents suffer for a systemic failure.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-40, Finchale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds, litter and dog fouling, 11th June
item.description:
Red lion passage has overgrown weeds. The unkept state encourages some people to toss their trash, not pick up their dog mess and antisocial behaviour such as people using the alley for smoking weed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Shooters Hill, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Continued parking in dropped kerb area causing lack of road visibility, 11th June
item.description:
There is a dropped kerb here without the continuation on the double yellow line. Cars and vans frequently park here to avoid the CPZ area and cause a major hazard to road users. This is a continuing problem causing accidents, damage to parked cars and altercations between drivers. Can the council please investigate as it is only a matter of time until this space causes someone to get really hurt. There was a car parked there again today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paths blocked by overgrown hedges, 11th June
item.description:
